original: Koritz, Henrik Meyer Hirsch, med. lic., prakt, läkare, Uddevalla, f. 14/10/ 04 i Norrköp. av grosshandl. Israel Koritz o. Anna Olschanski. G. 34 m. Astrid Rut Sederowsky. Barn: Bo Sören f. 35, Lars Peter 39, Sten John 41. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 22, med. kand. i Upps. 33, med. lic, i Sj:hlm 38. Div. förordn. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh., Södra BB i Sthlm, Seraf :las.. Mariestads las., Mora las., tf. und :läk. i Uddevalla 40-42, prakt. läk. i Uddevalla sed. 42, järnv :läk. å statsbamelinj. Svens-högen-Dingle, Udde valila-Eli enö o. Uddevalla-Ryr ised. 43, skolläk, v. koimim. flicksk. sed. 43, läk. v. liemanet f. gamlia o. sjuka sed. 43. von Kræmer, Robert Carl, apotekare, Strömstad, f. 10/6/79 i Lidköping av lärov:adj. Fredrik v. K. o. Hulda Björkman. G. 10 m. Signe Maria Pé-ters. Barn: Gunnar f. 12, Anne-Marie 15, Evert 19. — Mog:ex. i Skara 98, farm. kand. 02, apot:ex. 09. Elev v. apot. Hjorten i Lund 99-02, anst. i Lidköp., Marstrand, Avesta o. Kristinehamn 04-07, i Sollefteå, v. Hjorten i Lund 10-17, i Lysekil 17-19, Mora, Falun 19-22, Umeå, Lejonet i Växjö, Tre Kronor i Karlskrona 27-31, priv. å apot. i Robertsfors 31, transp. t. apot. i Strömstad 36, pens. 46. Verkst. dir. o. disp. i Kronobergs Brygg. A-B i Växjö 24-27. Sekr. i Gävleb.-Dala krets av Sv. farm:förb. 20-22, fullm. 21-23. Landst :kapten 25, landst:off. 14-31. Innehaft uppdr. som ordf., instruktör m. m. inom landst:- o. skyt-tefören. samt som chef f. scoutkårer. Var i Robertsfors led. av hälsov:nd samt rev. i Bygdeå s :n, led. av Strömstads hälsov:nd o. byggn:nd fr. 38, led. av Strömstads istadsfullm. sed. 43, av folksk :sityr., ordf. i luftskyddisfören. där 3i9. Ordf. i Bygdeå RK-krets 3i3’-3!6, i Strömstadskretsen 40-44. RVO, Man-nerheimiM, FM pro ben. hum., Landst-GM, 2 SM m. m.
translated: Koritz, Henrik Meyer Hirsch, med. lic., practicing physician, Uddevalla, b. 14/10/04 in Norrköping, to merchant Israel Koritz and Anna Olschanski. Married in 1934 to Astrid Rut Sederowsky. Children: Bo Sören b. 1935, Lars Peter b. 1939, Sten John b. 1941. - Completed high school in Norrköping in 1922, medical degree in Uppsala in 1933, medical license in Stockholm in 1938. Various appointments at Sabbatsbergs Hospital, Södra BB in Stockholm, Seraf:lassan, Mariestad Hospital, Mora Hospital. Temporary assistant physician in Uddevalla from 1940-1942, practicing physician in Uddevalla since 1942, railway physician on the Svenshögen-Dingle, Uddevalla-Elieno, and Uddevalla-Ryr lines since 1943. School physician for the municipal girls' school since 1943, physician for the old and sick at Liemanet since 1943. - Von Kræmer, Robert Carl, pharmacist, Strömstad, b. 10/6/79 in Lidköping, to senior teacher Fredrik v. K. and Hulda Björkman. Married in 1910 to Signe Maria Péters. Children: Gunnar b. 1912, Anne-Marie b. 1915, Evert b. 1919. - Completed college in Skara in 1898, pharmaceutical degree in 1902, pharmacy license in 1909. Apprentice at Hjorten pharmacy in Lund from 1899-1902, employed in Lidköping, Marstrand, Avesta, and Kristinehamn from 1904-1907, in Sollefteå, at Hjorten pharmacy in Lund from 1910-1917, in Lysekil from 1917-1919, Mora and Falun from 1919-1922, Umeå, Lejonet in Växjö, Tre Kronor in Karlskrona from 1927-1931, private at Robertsfors pharmacy from 1931, transferred to Strömstad pharmacy in 1936, retired in 1946. Director and manager at Kronobergs Bryggeri AB in Växjö from 1924-1927. Secretary of the Gävleb.-Dala district of the Swedish Pharmaceutical Association from 1920-1922, delegate from 1921-1923. Captain of the National Guard in 1925, officer in the National Guard from 1914-1931. Held positions as chairman, instructor, etc. within the National Guard and shooting associations, as well as chief for scout troops. Member of the health board in Robertsfors and the review board in Bygdeå, member of the health board and building board in Strömstad from 1938, member of the Strömstad municipal council since 1943, member of the school board, chairman of the air defense association from 1939. Chairman of the Bygdeå Red Cross district from 1933-1936, chairman of the Strömstad district from 1940-1944. Recipient of the Royal Order of Vasa, Mannherheim Music Medal, Royal Swedish Academy of Letters, History and Antiquities Medal, and other honors.

work.name: Liemanet
work.description: Physician for the old and sick
